newsitem.title: GERMANY: DHL DEVELOPING INTERNET SALES AT BRUSSELS HQ.
newsitem.headline: DHL DEVELOPING INTERNET SALES AT BRUSSELS HQ.

text.p: DHL International will proceed cautiously with online sales through its Internet home page, the integrator's Germany division said.

Ulrich Hartmann, managing director of DHL Worldwide Express GmbH, told Reuters in an interview: "We are preparing to offer something but we are very careful about what we offer. It is too early to say what use (of the Internet) is there."
The DHL World Wide Web site currently offers clients tracking of shipments by waybill number and general DHL information.
The company's Brussels head office was developing the Internet service cautiously since there were large differences in client awareness and use of electronic services, Hartmann noted.
"Electronic sales is very specialised. In every firm there are technology freaks but you also have people without access and knowledge," he added.
"We will still have telephone sales. Telephone sales are still much quicker than through the Internet," he noted.
